Item.name: useGravityCompensation
Item.description: Apply gravity compensation as well?

Item.name: addPatch
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: localVectors
Item.description: normal,hitPoint are in local coordinates of bodyPart

Item.name: applyImpulse
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: equalizeAmount
Item.description: 0 means straight impulse, 1 means multiply by the mass (change in velocity)

Item.name: partIndex
Item.description: index of part being hit.

Item.name: impulse
Item.description: impulse vector (impulse is change in momentum)

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: optional point on part where hit

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: normal,hitPoint are in local coordinates of bodyPart

Item.name: applyBulletImpulse
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: equalizeAmount
Item.description: 0 means straight impulse, 1 means multiply by the mass (change in velocity)

Item.name: partIndex
Item.description: index of part being hit.

Item.name: impulse
Item.description: impulse vector (impulse is change in momentum)

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: optional point on part where hit

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: true = hitPoint is in local coordinates of bodyPart, false = hitpoint is in world coordinates

Item.name: bodyRelax
Item.description: bodyRelax: Set the amount of relaxation across the whole body; Used to collapse the character into a rag-doll-like state.

Item.name: relaxation
Item.description: How relaxed the body becomes, in percentage relaxed. 100 being totally rag-dolled, 0 being very stiff and rigid.

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: holdPose
Item.description: automatically hold the current pose as the character relaxes - can be used to avoid relaxing into a t-pose

Item.name: configureBalance
Item.description: configureBalance: This single message allows you to configure various parameters used on any behaviour that uses the dynamic balance.

Item.name: stepHeight
Item.description: maximum height that character steps vertically (above 0.2 is high...but ok for say underwater)

Item.name: stepHeightInc4Step
Item.description: added to stepHeight if going up steps

Item.name: legsApartRestep
Item.description: if the legs end up more than (legsApartRestep + hipwidth) apart even though balanced, take another step

Item.name: legsTogetherRestep
Item.description: mmmm0.1 for drunk if the legs end up less than (hipwidth - legsTogetherRestep) apart even though balanced, take another step. A value of 1 will turn off this feature and the max value is hipWidth = 0.23f by default but is model dependent

Item.name: taperKneeStrength
Item.description: does the knee strength reduce with angle

Item.name: legStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of legs

Item.name: leftLegSwingDamping
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: rightLegSwingDamping
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: opposeGravityLegs
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: opposeGravityAnkles
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: ankleEquilibrium
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: balanceAbortThreshold
Item.description: when the character gives up and goes into a fall

Item.name: giveUpHeight
Item.description: height between lowest foot and COM below which balancer will give up

Item.name: stepClampScaleVariance
Item.description: Variance in clamp scale every step. if negative only takes away from clampScale

Item.name: predictionTimeHip
Item.description: amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to move hip to (kind of). Will be controlled by balancer in future but can help recover spine quicker from bending forwards to much.

Item.name: predictionTime
Item.description: amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to step to. bigger values try to recover with fewer, bigger steps. smaller values recover with smaller steps, and generally recover less.

Item.name: predictionTimeVariance
Item.description: Variance in predictionTime every step. if negative only takes away from predictionTime

Item.name: maxSteps
Item.description: Maximum number of steps that the balancer will take.

Item.name: fallType
Item.description: How to fall after maxSteps or maxBalanceTime: 0=rampDown stiffness, 1= 0 and dontChangeStep, 2= 0 and forceBalance, 3=0 and slump (BCR has to be active)

Item.name: fallMult
Item.description: Multiply the rampDown of stiffness on falling by this amount (>1 fall quicker)

Item.name: fallReduceGravityComp
Item.description: Reduce gravity compensation as the legs weaken on falling

Item.name: maxBalanceTime
Item.description: Maximum time(seconds) that the balancer will balance for.

Item.name: stableLinSpeedThresh
Item.description: Linear speed threshold for successful balance.

Item.name: stableRotSpeedThresh
Item.description: Rotational speed threshold for successful balance.

Item.name: ignoreFailure
Item.description: Ignore maxSteps and maxBalanceTime and try to balance forever

Item.name: changeStepTime
Item.description: time not in contact (airborne) before step is changed. If -ve don't change step

Item.name: balanceIndefinitely
Item.description: Ignore maxSteps and maxBalanceTime and try to balance forever

Item.name: rampHipPitchOnFail
Item.description: bend over when falling after maxBalanceTime

Item.name: movingFloor
Item.description: temporary variable to ignore movingFloor code that generally causes the character to fall over if the feet probe a moving object e.g. treading on a gun

Item.name: airborneStep
Item.description: when airborne try to step. Set to false for e.g. shotGun reaction

Item.name: useComDirTurnVelThresh
Item.description: Velocity below which the balancer turns in the direction of the COM forward instead of the ComVel - for use with shot from running with high upright constraint use 1.9

Item.name: minKneeAngle
Item.description: Minimum knee angle (-ve value will mean this functionality is not applied). 0.4 seems a good value

Item.name: stepIfInSupport
Item.description: The balancer sometimes decides to step even if balanced

Item.name: standUp
Item.description: standup more with increased velocity

Item.name: stepWithBoth
Item.description: step with both legs DANGER will not balance well if this is true

Item.name: giveUpHeightEnd
Item.description: if this value is different from giveUpHeight, actual giveUpHeight will be ramped toward this value

Item.name: balanceAbortThresholdEnd
Item.description: if this value is different from balanceAbortThreshold, actual balanceAbortThreshold will be ramped toward this value

Item.name: giveUpRampDuration
Item.description: duration of ramp from start of behaviour for above two parameters. If smaller than 0, no ramp is applied

Item.name: leanToAbort
Item.description: lean at which to send abort message when maxSteps or maxBalanceTime is reached

Item.name: configureBalanceReset
Item.description: configureBalanceReset: reset the values configurable by the Configure Balance message to their defaults.

Item.name: configureBullets
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: impulseSpreadOverParts
Item.description: spreads impulse across parts. currently only for spine parts, not limbs.

Item.name: impulseLeakageStrengthScaled
Item.description: for weaker characters subsequent impulses remain strong

Item.name: impulsePeriod
Item.description: duration that impulse is spread over (triangular shaped)

Item.name: impulseTorqueScale
Item.description: An impulse applied at a point on a body equivalent to an impulse at the centre of the body and a torque. This parameter scales the torque component. (The torque component seems to be excite the rage looseness bug which sends the character in a sometimes wildly different direction to an applied impulse)

Item.name: loosenessFix
Item.description: Fix the rage looseness bug by applying only the impulse at the centre of the body unless it is a spine part then apply the twist component only of the torque as well.

Item.name: impulseDelay
Item.description: time from hit before impulses are being applied

Item.name: impulseReductionPerShot
Item.description: by how much are subsequent impulses reduced (e.g. 0.0: no reduction, 0.1: 10% reduction each new hit)

Item.name: impulseRecovery
Item.description: recovery rate of impulse strength per second (impulse strength from 0.0:1.0). At 60fps a impulseRecovery=60.0 will recover in 1 frame

Item.name: torqueMode
Item.description: 0: Disabled | 1: character strength proportional (can reduce impulse amount) | 2: Additive (no reduction of impulse and not proportional to character strength)

Item.name: torqueSpinMode
Item.description: 0: spin direction from impulse direction | 1: random direction | 2: direction flipped with each bullet (for burst effect)

Item.name: torqueFilterMode
Item.description: 0: apply torque for every bullet | 1: only apply new torque if previous has finished | 2: Only apply new torque if its spin direction is different from previous torque

Item.name: torqueAlwaysSpine3
Item.description: always apply torques to spine3 instead of actual part hit

Item.name: torqueDelay
Item.description: time from hit before torques are being applied

Item.name: torquePeriod
Item.description: duration of torque

Item.name: torqueGain
Item.description: multiplies impulse magnitude to arrive at torque that is applied

Item.name: torqueCutoff
Item.description: minimum ratio of impulse that remains after converting to torque (if in strength-proportional mode)

Item.name: torqueReductionPerTick
Item.description: ratio of torque for next tick (e.g. 1.0: not reducing over time, 0.9: each tick torque is reduced by 10%)

Item.name: liftGain
Item.description: amount of lift (directly multiplies torque axis to give lift force)

Item.name: counterImpulseDelay
Item.description: time after impulse is applied that counter impulse is applied

Item.name: counterImpulseMag
Item.description: amount of the original impulse that is countered

Item.name: counterAfterMagReached
Item.description: applies the counter impulse counterImpulseDelay(secs) after counterImpulseMag of the Impulse has been applied

Item.name: doCounterImpulse
Item.description: add a counter impulse to the pelvis

Item.name: counterImpulse2Hips
Item.description: amount of the counter impulse applied to hips - the rest is applied to the part originally hit

Item.name: impulseAirMult
Item.description: amount to scale impulse by if the character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK and impulse is above impulseAirMultStart

Item.name: impulseAirMultStart
Item.description: if impulse is above this value scale it by impulseAirMult

Item.name: impulseAirMax
Item.description: amount to clamp impulse to if character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseAirApplyAbove
Item.description: if impulse is above this amount then do not scale/clamp just let it through as is - it's a shotgun or cannon

Item.name: impulseAirOn
Item.description: scale and/or clamp impulse if the character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseOneLegMult
Item.description: amount to scale impulse by if the character is contacting with one foot only and dynamicBalance is OK and impulse is above impulseAirMultStart

Item.name: impulseOneLegMultStart
Item.description: if impulse is above this value scale it by impulseOneLegMult

Item.name: impulseOneLegMax
Item.description: amount to clamp impulse to if character is contacting with one foot only and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseOneLegApplyAbove
Item.description: if impulse is above this amount then do not scale/clamp just let it through as is - it's a shotgun or cannon

Item.name: impulseOneLegOn
Item.description: scale and/or clamp impulse if the character is contacting with one leg only and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: rbForce
Item.description: Leave this alone!!! (for testing of torque removing bullets)

Item.name: rbRatio
Item.description: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbMoment
Item.description: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArm
Item.description: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArm
Item.description: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbRatioAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbMomentAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArmAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArmAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbRatioOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbMomentOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArmOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArmOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbTwistAxis
Item.description: Twist axis 0=World Up, 1=CharacterCOM up

Item.name: rbPivot
Item.description: if false pivot around COM always, if true change pivot depending on foot contact: to feet centre if both feet in contact, or foot position if 1 foot in contact or COM position if no feet in contact

Item.name: configureLimits
Item.description: configureLimits: Enable/disable/edit character limits in real time. This adjusts limits in RAGE-native space and will *not* reorient the joint.

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value for joint limits to configure. Ignored if index != -1.

Item.name: enable
Item.description: If false, disable (set all to PI, -PI) limits.

Item.name: toDesired
Item.description: If true, set limits to accommodate current desired angles

Item.name: restore
Item.description: Return to cached defaults?

Item.name: index
Item.description: Index of effector to configure. Set to -1 to use mask.

Item.name: lean1
Item.description: Custom limit values to use if not setting limits to desired. Limits are RAGE-native, not NM-wrapper-native.

Item.name: configureShotInjuredArm
Item.description: configureShotInjuredArm: This single message allows you to configure the injured arm reaction during shot

Item.name: injuredArmTime
Item.description: length of the reaction

Item.name: hipYaw
Item.description: Amount of hip twist. (Negative values twist into bullet direction - probably not what is wanted)

Item.name: hipRoll
Item.description: Amount of hip roll

Item.name: forceStepExtraHeight
Item.description: Additional height added to stepping foot

Item.name: shrugTime
Item.description: Exaggerate arm hit by shrugging the clavicles - this unfortunately makes the ik solution for tuck into body too chicken arms so don't do it for too long

Item.name: forceStep
Item.description: force a step to be taken whether pushed out of balance or not

Item.name: stepTurn
Item.description: turn the character using the balancer

Item.name: velMultiplierStart
Item.description: Start velocity where parameters begin to be ramped down to zero linearly

Item.name: velMultiplierEnd
Item.description: End velocity of ramp where parameters are scaled to zero

Item.name: velForceStep
Item.description: Velocity above which a step is not forced

Item.name: velStepTurn
Item.description: Velocity above which a stepTurn is not asked for

Item.name: velScales
Item.description: Use the velocity scaling parameters. Tune for standing still then use velocity scaling to make sure a running character stays balanced (the turning tends to make the character fall over more at speed)

Item.description: fireWeapon: One shot message apply a force to the hand as we fire the gun that should be in this hand

Item.name: firedWeaponStrength
Item.description: The force of the gun.

Item.name: gunHandEnum
Item.description: Which hand in the gun in, 0 = left, 1 = right.

Item.name: applyFireGunForceAtClavicle
Item.description: Should we apply some of the force at the shoulder. Force double handed weapons (Ak47 etc).

Item.name: extraWristLean1
Item.description: Extra lean1 on the wrist

Item.name: extraWristLean2
Item.description: Extra lean2 on the wrist

Item.name: inhibitTime
Item.description: Minimum time before next fire impulse

Item.name: direction
Item.description: direction of impulse in hand frame

Item.name: split
Item.description: Split force between hand and clavicle when applyFireGunForceAtClavicle is true. 1 = all hand, 0 = all clavicle.

Item.name: configureSupportHandConstraint
Item.description: configureSupportHandConstraint: One shot to configure support hand constraint for point gun and split body

Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: useForces
Item.description: enable force based constraint

Item.name: useTorques
Item.description: enable torque based constraint

Item.name: velocityBased
Item.description: make strength of constraint function of COM velocity. Uses -1 for forceDamping if the damping is positive.

Item.name: torqueOnlyInAir
Item.description: only apply torque based constraint when airBorne

Item.name: forceStrength
Item.description: strength of constraint

Item.name: forceDamping
Item.description: damping in constraint: -1 makes it scale automagically with forceStrength. Other negative values will scale this automagic damping.

Item.name: forceFeetMult
Item.description: multiplier to the force applied to the feet

Item.name: forceSpine3Share
Item.description: share of pelvis force applied to spine3

Item.name: forceLeanReduction
Item.description: how much the character lean is taken into account when reducing the force.

Item.name: forceInAirShare
Item.description: share of the feet force to the airborne foot

Item.name: forceMin
Item.description: when min and max are greater than 0 the constraint strength is determined from character strength, scaled into the range given by min and max

Item.name: forceMax
Item.description: see above

Item.name: forceSaturationVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity at which constraint reaches maximum strength (forceStrength)

Item.name: forceThresholdVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity above which constraint starts applying forces

Item.name: torqueStrength
Item.description: strength of torque based constraint

Item.name: torqueDamping
Item.description: damping of torque based constraint

Item.name: torqueSaturationVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity at which constraint reaches maximum strength (torqueStrength)

Item.name: torqueThresholdVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity above which constraint starts applying torques

Item.name: supportPosition
Item.description: distance the foot is behind Com projection that is still considered able to generate the support for the upright constraint

Item.name: noSupportForceMult
Item.description: still apply this fraction of the upright constaint force if the foot is not in a position (defined by supportPosition) to generate the support for the upright constraint

Item.name: stopAllBehaviours
Item.description: stopAllBehaviours: Send this message to immediately stop all behaviours from executing.

Item.description: stiffness of masked joints. -ve values mean don't apply stiffness or damping (just use defaults or ones applied by behaviours). If you are using animpose fullbody on its own then this gives the opprtunity to use setStffness and setMuscleStiffness messages to set up the character's muscles. mmmmtodo get rid of this -ve

Item.name: muscleStiffnessRightArm
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to right arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to spine (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessLeftLeg
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to left leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessRightLeg
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to right leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.description: stiffness applied to left arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessRightArm
Item.description: stiffness applied to right arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessSpine

Item.name: distanceToSendSuccessMessage

Item.name: reachDistanceFromHitPoint

Item.name: minReachDistanceFromHitPoint

Item.name: angleTotallyBack
Item.description: max angle in degrees (between 1.the vector between two hips and 2. wallEdge) to try to reach the wall just behind his pelvis with his arms when the character is back to the wall.

Item.name: legInjurySpineBend
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when not lifting leg

Item.name: legInjuryLiftSpineBend
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when lifting leg (lifting happens when not stepping with other leg)

Item.description: Leg lift duration (reaction to being shot in leg)

Item.description: additional stability for hands and neck (less loose)

Item.description: use the catch fall instead of RollUp when the balance fails during Shot (eg. the character isn't dead yet!)

Item.name: useExtendedCatchFall
Item.description: keep the character active instead of relaxing at the end of the catch fall

Item.description: duration of the ramp to bring the character's upper body stiffness back to normal levels

Item.description: if enabled upper and lower body strength scales with character strength, using the range given by parameters below

Item.description: proportions to what the strength would be normally

Item.description: time to death (HACK for underwater). If -ve don't ever die

Item.name: bodyPart
Item.description: part ID on the body where the bullet hit

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: if true then normal and hitPoint should be supplied in local coordinates of bodyPart. If false then normal and hitPoint should be supplied in World coordinates

Item.name: normal
Item.description: Normal coming out of impact point on character. Can be local or global depending on localHitPointInfo

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: position of impact on character. Can be local or global depending on localHitPointInfo

Item.name: bulletVel
Item.description: bullet velocity in world coordinates

Item.description: The character snaps in a prescribed way (decided by bullet direction) - Higher the value the more random this direction is.

Item.description: snap the rightLeg.

Item.description: snap the neck.

Item.description: Legs are either in phase with each other or not

Item.name: snapHipType
Item.description: type of hip reaction 0=none, 1=side2side 2=steplike

Item.name: snapUseBulletDir
Item.description: Legs are either in phase with each other or not

Item.name: unSnapInterval
Item.description: Interval before applying reverse snap

Item.name: unSnapRatio
Item.description: The magnitude of the reverse snap

Item.name: shotShockSpin
Item.description: shotShockSpin: configure the shockSpin effect in shot. Spin/Lift the character using cheat torques/forces

Item.name: addShockSpin
Item.description: if enabled, add a short 'shock' of torque to the character's spine to exaggerate bullet impact

Item.name: randomizeShockSpinDirection
Item.description: for use with close-range shotgun blasts, or similar

Item.name: alwaysAddShockSpin
Item.description: if true, apply the shock spin no matter which body component was hit. otherwise only apply if the spine or clavicles get hit

Item.name: shockSpinMin
Item.description: minimum amount of torque to add if using shock-spin feature

Item.name: shockSpinMax
Item.description: maxiumum amount of torque to add if using shock-spin feature

Item.name: shockSpinLiftForceMult
Item.description: if greater than 0, apply a force to lift the character up while the torque is applied, trying to produce a dramatic spun/twist shotgun-to-the-chest effect. this is a scale of the torque applied, so 8.0 or so would give a reasonable amount of lift

Item.name: shockSpinDecayMult
Item.description: multiplier used when decaying torque spin over time

Item.name: shockSpinScalePerComponent
Item.description: torque applied is scaled by this amount across the spine components - spine2 recieving the full amount, then 3 and 1 and finally 0. each time, this value is used to scale it down. 0.5 means half the torque each time.

Item.name: shockSpinMaxTwistVel
Item.description: shock spin ends when twist velocity is greater than this value (try 6.0). If set to -1 does not stop

Item.name: shockSpinScaleByLeverArm
Item.description: shock spin scales by lever arm of bullet i.e. bullet impact point to centre line

Item.name: shockSpinAirMult
Item.description: shockSpin's torque is multipied by this value when both the character's feet are not in contact

Item.name: shockSpin1FootMult
Item.description: shockSpin's torque is multipied by this value when the one of the character's feet are not in contact

Item.name: shockSpinFootGripMult
Item.description: shockSpin scales the torques applied to the feet by footSlipCompensation

Item.description: blind brace with arms if appropriate

Item.description: Point gun if appropriate.

Item.name: useArmsWindmill
Item.description: armsWindmill if going backwards fast enough

Item.description: release wound if going sideways/forward fast enough. 0 = don't. 1 = only if bracing. 2 = any default arm reaction

Item.description: Inhibit arms brace for this amount of time after reachForWound has begun

Item.description: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of speed of circling is proportional to character speed (max speed of circliing increase = 1.5). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-1.5 is applied over

Item.name: AWRadiusMult
Item.description: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of radii is proportional to character speed (max radius increase = 0.45). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-0.45 is applied over

Item.name: AWStiffnessAdd
Item.description: For armsWindmill, added arm stiffness ranges from 0 to AWStiffnessAdd

Item.description: Force character to reach for wound with left hand regardless of hand state.

Item.name: forceRightReachForWound
Item.description: Force character to reach for wound with right hand regardless of hand state.

Item.name: reachForWoundWithGun
Item.description: Reach for wound with left hand regardless of weapon state.
